intro: Caldcluvia celebica, commonly known as the Celebes starling tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its dense, rounded crown and smooth, greyish bark. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in terminal spikes, followed by woody, egg-shaped fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forest areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
